newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Pilipinas Shell looks at peso before hiking prices.
newsitem.headline: Pilipinas Shell looks at peso before hiking prices.

text.p: Pilipinas Shell Petroleum Corp said on Monday it will wait for the peso to settle down before adjusting domestic fuel prices.

"The view perhaps is to look at the situation within two weeks from July 11," company president Oscar Reyes said in a television interview, referring to the day when the peso was effectively devalued.
The peso regained in recent days some of its losses after hitting a record low of 30.00 to the dollar earlier last week.
Reyes said Shell will likely be adjusting its pump prices within the month, adding the depreciation was now "hitting us."
Industry calculations show that for every one peso depreciation, there should be an increase of 14 centavos per litre to recover the cost of crude oil, Reyes said.

Reyes indicated an increase in the local prices of oil products will not have a substantial impact on prices of commodities because local oil prices have generally declined since February when the oil industry was fully deregulated.
Pilipinas is the local unit of the Royal Dutch/Shell group of companies and is one of three oil refiners in the country.
